results.title: Before production begins
results.brief_description: The story of the birth of a new holden car, from an artist’s conception,through the modelling of small and full scale models, to the making of the first prototype model. From the hundreds of scale drawings, skilled craftsmen create by hand, the hundreds of engine and body components of the prototype. Laboratory and road tests of components and the completed prototype ensue that every section of the car conforms to rigid engineering specifications. Only after all this preliminary work can mass production begin on a new model holden car.

results.title: Before night falls [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Julian Schnabel, Jon Kilik and Grandview Pictures
results.brief_description: Before night falls is Julian Schnabel’s second feature, his follow-up to “Basquiat”. The story of Cuban poet and writer Reinaldo Arenas, the screenplay is based on Arenas’ memoirs. The film opens with Arenas’ idyllic, if impoverished youth - brought up by his adoring mother and a dictatorial father who forbade his son’s poetry. A shift to the city exposes Arenas to urban influences and his teachers encourage his artistic expression. Openly gay and politically active, the adult Arenas finds himself persecuted by the Castro regime and his writing is smuggled to France in order to be published. Javier Bardem plays Arenas as a passionate, talented hedonist whose attempts to escape incarceration are both daring and foolhardy. The cinematography depicts Cuba as a magical and beautiful place, saturated in decaying splendour, which is crippled by corruption and state sanctioned police brutality. Schnabel employs an episodic structure to relay the key moments of Arenas’ life. Cuba - a place teeming with culture, food, love, sex and passion - is contrasted with Arenas’ ‘freedom’ in New York. Despite his liberation Arenas is depressed, living austerely and the scenes take on a bleached aesthetic, reflecting perhaps the writer’s longing for his rich homeland.

results.title: Before Midnight
results.headline_credit: Greece and United States of America, 2013
results.brief_description: We meet Jesse and Celine nine years on in Greece. Almost two decades have passed since their first meeting on that train bound for Vienna.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs and Yorgos Lanthimos
constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

results.title: Before It's Too Late - Teenage Suicide (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This important film can be used to teach students how to spot suicidal behaviour in their friends and it impresses upon them that they can actually save a life by being a supportive friend.

results.title: Before it's too late
results.brief_description: A road safety film emphasizing the importance of using seat belts in vehicles and how they do save lives. Collision tests conducted at the University of California show what can happen in an accident. The uncontrolled movements can damage the body in numerous ways, ejection being the most fatal. Thousands of lives could have been saved if people used their seat belts rather than sat on them. Features Dick Van Dyke.

results.title: Before death us do part: a do-it-yourself guide to divorce
results.creator_credit: Tony Wright, Trevor Graham, Sharon Connolly, Film Victoria and Yarra Bank Films
results.brief_description: A humourous but educational approach looking at the process of how to obtain a divorce in Australia. Using the forum of a talk-back radio program, callers with questions about divorce are dealt with by the announcer, Abby Wright, in a clear and informative style. The program is accompanied by a User Guide and can be used as an educational tool in demonstrating the process of obtaining a divorce in Australia.
results.title_for_label: Before death us do part: a do-it-yourself guide to divorce

results.title: Before 9:30
results.creator_credit: Brigid Kitchin and Macquarie University. Dept. of Media and Communication Studies
results.brief_description: Inspired by a real life incident, this short film is a timely and poignant reminder about the anguish experienced by young children at primary school. Intended as a discussion piece for counsellors, teachers and family care workers. Cast includes Evan Sheaves, Jessica Rees and Nathy Gaffney.

results.title: Beetles
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Life histories of the tiger, ladybird and Japanese beetles. Many rarely observed events in their lives are presented: some comic, some tragic. The economic relations of beetles to man is brought out. Some beetles have been pressed into the service of man, while others are harmful and must be destroyed.

results.title: Beetle juice
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Richard Hashimoto, Larry Wilson, Michael Bender and The Geffen Company
results.brief_description: Geena Davis and Alec Baldwin are happy, content and alive until a car accident turns them into ghosts, forever stuck in an afterlife - a holding cell for people who have died of unnatural causes. No sooner is the funeral over and their home is sold and “invaded” by two new trendy tenants. In desperation they enlist the help of a freelance bio-exorcist, Betelgeuse (Michael Keaton), to scare the new owners off the premises. This notion provides Keaton with a vehicle for showing off his comic talents. Story by Michael McDowell and Larry Wilson with music by Danny Elfman. Cast includes Geena Davis, Alec Baldwin, Michael Keaton, Catherine O’Hara and Winona Ryder. (Awards: Oscar for Best Achievement in Makeup).

results.title: Beethoven....and all that jazz
results.brief_description: An experimental film in which a jazz orchestra is seen playing against background music of a Beethoven’s Piano Sonato No. 29. No other credits available.
